title: Bills' Hamlin will put $9.1M in donations into his charity
description: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin will use the $10 million given to online fundraising campaigns by well-wishers after his on-field collapse to fund his own nonprofit, the Chasing M’s Foundation

title: Judge in Trump criminal case issues protective order to prevent sharing of evidence
description: A judge imposed a protective order Monday in the Manhattan DA's criminal case against former President Trump to help ensure evidence in the case does not wind up online.

title: Mom's terrifying moments hiding during mall massacre: 'I can't die like this'
description: A mom of two is recounting the harrowing moments she and other shoppers huddled for safety as a massacre unfolded at the Allen Premium Outlets.

title: Grace Bumbry, 1st Black singer at Bayreuth, dies at 86
description: Grace Bumbry, a pioneering mezzo-soprano who became the first Black singer to perform at Germany's Bayreuth Festival during a career of more than three decades on the world’s top stages, has died

title: Barbara Kingsolver, Hernan Diaz win fiction Pulitzer Prizes
description: The Pulitzer Prize for fiction was awarded Monday to two class-conscious novels: “Demon Copperhead,” Barbara Kingsolver’s modern recasting of the Dickens classic “David Copperfield,” and Hernan Diaz’s “Trust,” an innovative narrative of wealth and dece...

title: Colorado woman found guilty of killing 11-year-old stepson
description: A Colorado woman was found guilty of murder in the death of her 11-year-old stepson Monday

title: Uvalde families get a win on gun control at Texas state Capitol
description: The rotunda of the Texas state Capitol echoed Monday with pleadings from more activists who gathered in Austin to demand the legislature take action on gun reform.

title: Biden's other student loan program cancels $42B for public service workers
description: The Department of Education has approved $42 billion dollars in student loan forgiveness for more than 615,000 public service workers since October 2021

title: North Dakota governor signs law protecting tribal adoptions
description: North Dakota’s Republican Gov. Doug Burgum has signed a law that protects tribal cultures by codifying the federal Indian Child Welfare Act into state law

title: Biden, Buttigieg push for airlines to compensate passengers for some delays
description: President Joe Biden and Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg on Monday announced a new effort to requiring airlines to compensate passengers.

title: WATCH:  Prince Louis and Prince George enjoy s’mores at coronation volunteer event
description: The young royals roasted s'mores with their sister Princess Charlotte, as well as their parents Prince William and Princess Kate, at a Big Help Out event following the coronation of King Charles III.

title: Bidens to host UConn, LSU basketball teams at WH this month
description: President Joe Biden and his wife, Jill, plan to welcome the men’s and women’s NCAA basketball champions to the White House on Friday, May 26

title: Virginia teen dies from sand hole collapse in North Carolina
description: Authorities are investigating the death of a teenager who became trapped in a hole that was dug in the sand on North Carolina's Outer Banks

title: Americans bet $220B on sports in 5 years since legalization
description: Americans have bet over $220 billion on sports with legal gambling outlets in the five years since the U.S. Supreme Court cleared the way for all 50 states to offer it

title: Ex-girlfriend: Tiger Woods used lawyer to break up with me
description: Golf superstar Tiger Woods wants a judge to halt his ex-girlfriend's lawsuits seeking $30 million

title: 'Outraged' letter carriers demand action to stop robberies
description: Postal carriers have more worries than snow, rain or the gloom of night keeping them from their appointed rounds

title: Virginia jail escapee captured after seeking medical help
description: A second inmate who escaped from a Virginia jail last week has been apprehended on the campus of Longwood University

title: US backs study of safe injection sites, overdose prevention
description: The U.S. government will pay for a large study measuring whether safe injection sites can make a dent in the nation's overdose epidemic

title: Deputies kill man in South Carolina traffic stop shootout
description: Investigators say deputies shot and killed a man who opened fire on them during a traffic stop in South Carolina

title: County official vows to fight NYC mayor's migrant bus plan
description: A top official representing a suburban New York county where New York City’s mayor wants to send asylum seekers is vowing to fight the plan by enforcing a state of emergency

title: Sudan's rival forces hold peace talks amid shaky cease-fires
description: Sounds of fighting and artillery shooting could be heard in several parts of Sudan on Monday as talks between warring sides were underway in Saudi Arabia.

title: 'Risk it all': Migrant surge as US prepares for Title 42 end
description: A recent surge of migrants in the Brownsville, Texas, area of the U.S.-Mexico border is highlighting immigration challenges as the U.S. prepares for the end of a policy linked to the coronavirus pandemic that allowed it to quickly expel many migrants

title: Texas shooting witness describes 'massive trauma' as he helped victims
description: The moments after Saturday's shooting at an outdoor mall near Dallas, Texas, will never leave Joshua W. Barnwell's memory.

title: China tells US to 'reflect deeply' over downturn in ties
description: China’s foreign minister has told the U.S. ambassador that Washington is responsible for the downturn in relations between the two countries and must “reflect deeply” before ties can return to a healthy track

title: Macron leads ceremony marking end of WWII in Europe
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has led the traditional ceremony on Paris’ Champs-Elysees Monday commemorating May 8, the day that marked the end of World War II in Europe in 1945

title: How Parkland mom hopes new book can shine light on gun reform
description: The parents of Parkland victim Joaquin Oliver are bringing their new "children's book" to Washington, D.C., lawmakers in an effort to shine a light on gun control.

title: Biden, McCarthy face serious time crunch to reach debt ceiling deal
description: The House and Senate each have roughly a dozen working days left before Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen's June 1 default warning.

title: Gunman on the loose after Dallas train shooting that killed 1, injured 2
description: One person is dead and two are injured after a fight broke out between two people on a Dallas Area Rapid Transit train, a spokesperson said.

title: Iran hangs 2 in rare blasphemy case as executions surge
description: Iran has hanged two men convicted of blasphemy

title: Sudan doctors: At least 100 killed in armed fighter clashes
description: Sudan's Doctors Syndicate says at least 100 people were killed in clashes that erupted last month between armed fighters in a city in Sudan’s restive region of Darfur

title: Japanese, South Korean leaders vow better ties following summit
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is calling for officials to map out specific steps to hasten security and economic cooperation with Japan following his weekend summit in Seoul with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida

title: Fire in gold mine kills at least 27, Peruvian officials say
description: A fire deep in a gold mine in southern Peru has killed 27 workers during an overnight shift

title: Out-of-control wildfires cause evacuations in western Canada
description: Cooler temperatures and rain bring some relief, but only in some areas.
